questions.question: What is machine learning?
choices: Teaching computers to think like humans
Enabling computers to learn from data

questions.question: Which of these is an example of supervised learning?
What is a neural network?
choices: A computer network optimized for AI
A collection of algorithms mimicking the human brain

questions.question: What does NLP stand for in AI?
Which algorithm is commonly used for recommendation systems?
What is overfitting in machine learning?
choices: When a model performs too well on training data but poorly on new data
When a model is too large for the available memory
When a model has too many parameters

questions.question: What is the purpose of the activation function in neural networks?
Which of these is a common deep learning framework?
What is reinforcement learning?
What is a convolutional neural network (CNN) typically used for?
Which of these is an example of unsupervised learning?
What is the Turing Test in AI?
choices: A test for computer processing power
A test for determining if machines can think like humans
A benchmark for neural network performance
A security test for AI systems

questions.question: What does 'bias' refer to in machine learning?
choices: The tendency of a model to consistently learn certain patterns

questions.question: What is a decision tree in machine learning?
choices: A hierarchical model making decisions based on conditions
A tree-like visualization of neural networks

questions.question: What is gradient descent used for in machine learning?
Which of these is NOT a common type of neural network?
What is transfer learning?
choices: Using knowledge from one task to help with another task
Transferring data between neural network layers

questions.question: What are 'features' in machine learning?
choices: The independent variables used for prediction

questions.question: What is K-means used for?
What does a confusion matrix show?
choices: The performance of a classification model

questions.question: What is the purpose of cross-validation in machine learning?
choices: To evaluate a model's performance on unseen data

questions.question: Which of these is a type of generative AI model?
What does the term 'hyperparameter' refer to in machine learning?
choices: A parameter set automatically during training
A parameter that controls the learning process
A parameter with very high values
A parameter inside the neural network

questions.question: What is the purpose of data normalization?
choices: To scale features to a similar range

questions.question: What is the main goal of unsupervised learning?
choices: To find hidden patterns in data

questions.question: What is a chatbot?
choices: A robot that chats with humans
An AI program that simulates conversation

questions.question: What is the purpose of feature engineering?
choices: To create new features from existing data

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using ensemble methods?
choices: Higher accuracy by combining multiple models

questions.question: What is a generative model?
choices: A model that generates new data similar to the training data
A model that predicts future values

questions.question: What is the purpose of a loss function in machine learning?
choices: To measure how well a model performs

questions.question: What is the main purpose of dimensionality reduction?
choices: To reduce the number of features while retaining important information

questions.question: What is a support vector machine (SVM)?
choices: A supervised learning algorithm for classification and regression

questions.question: What is the purpose of dropout in neural networks?
choices: To prevent overfitting by randomly dropping units during training

questions.question: What is a hyperparameter tuning?
choices: Finding the best set of hyperparameters for a model

questions.question: What is an autoencoder?
choices: A type of neural network used for unsupervised learning
A type of reinforcement learning algorithm

questions.question: What is the purpose of backpropagation in neural networks?
choices: To update weights based on the error

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using transfer learning?
choices: Faster training and better performance with less data

questions.question: What is the purpose of a validation set in machine learning?
choices: To evaluate the model's performance during training

questions.question: What is a recurrent neural network (RNN) typically used for?
choices: Natural language processing and time series prediction

questions.question: What is the purpose of a kernel in SVM?
choices: To transform data into a higher-dimensional space for better separation

questions.question: What is the main goal of clustering algorithms?
choices: To group similar data points together

questions.question: What is the purpose of regularization in machine learning?
choices: To prevent overfitting by adding a penalty to the loss function

questions.question: What is a generative adversarial network (GAN)?
choices: A type of neural network for classification
A framework for unsupervised learning using two competing networks

questions.question: What is the purpose of a test set in machine learning?
choices: To evaluate the model's performance on unseen data
